Header: 10 relief ships from Australia for the relief operations in Sri Lanka
Content: Australia has donated 10 ships to Sri Lanka with latest facilities and technology in order to rescue our people affected due to adverse weather. Australian High Commissioner in Sri Lanka made this donation yesterday to the Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake yesterday at the Rangala Navy premises in Colombo Port. Manwhile, due to the flood situation in Sri Lanka, Â 07 ships owned by 03 countries have arrived in the island so far. According to the Navy Spokesperson's Division, ships from India, Pakisthan and China have arrived in the island.
